quotes: In 1998, Iglesias released his third album Cosas del Amor (Things of Love).

organizations.name: Billboard
quotes: which topped the Billboard Hot Latin Songs chart as well as the charts of several Spanish-speaking countries.
both of which topped the Billboard Hot Latin Songs chart and helped cement his status in the Latin music scene.

organizations.name: American Music Award
quotes: Along with his father and Luís Miguel, Iglesias was nominated for an American Music Award in the first-ever awarded category of Favorite Latin Artist.
He won the American Music Award for Favorite Latin Artist for a second time, this time winning against Ricky Martin and Chayanne.

organizations.name: McDonald's
quotes: The Cosas del Amor Tour was the first ever concert tour sponsored by McDonald's.

roles.title: Favorite Latin Artist
quotes: Along with his father and Luís Miguel, Iglesias was nominated for an American Music Award in the first-ever awarded category of Favorite Latin Artist.
He won the American Music Award for Favorite Latin Artist for a second time, this time winning against Ricky Martin and Chayanne.

Beginning in Odessa, Texas, the tour went on to play three consecutive nights in Mexico City's Plaza de Toros, two nights at Monterrey's Auditorio Coca-Cola, and two nights (with over 50,000 attendees each) at the Estadio Ciudad de La Plata in Argentina, totaling over 130,000 people.

Beginning in Odessa, Texas, the tour went on to play three consecutive nights in Mexico City's Plaza de Toros, two nights at Monterrey's Auditorio Coca-Cola, and two nights (with over 50,000 attendees each) at the Estadio Ciudad de La Plata in Argentina, totaling over 130,000 people.
Iglesias did a shorter tour of smaller venues to accompany the release of the album, with one show being televised from Acapulco, México.
